result.execSummary:
The defendant Nakota Earl James Kline was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Payment of $300 fine + costs + service fees + DNA surcharge = $1,209.50 due at a rate of $200 per mth comm 12-01-22 or civil judgment and referral to State Debt Collections.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nakota Earl James Kline

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt:
2:06 PM Defendant Nakota Earl James Kline in court.  Attorney Scott H Lyon in court for Nakota Earl James Kline.  Attorney DeShea Morrow in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
Atty Lyon provides plea form.
DA heard on agreement.
Atty Lyon agrees.
Court arraigns Deft on Count 1.
Deft enters a plea of guilty.
Non-citizen advisory.
PleaQuest/WOR.
Constitutional rights.
Elements of offense.
Atty Lyon satisfied.
Factual basis.
Court finds Deft enters plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; therefore court accepts plea and finds Deft guilty to Count 1.
DA heard on sentencing.
Atty Lyon heard on sentencing.
Deft heard.
Court heard on factors.
Court imposes: 
Payment of $300 fine + costs + service fees + DNA surcharge = $1209.50 due at $200 per month beginning 12-01-2022 or civil judgment and referral to State Debt Collections.
DNA sample due 10-17-2022.
Appeal rights.
2:23 PM

9:07 AM Attorney Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Scott H Lyon in court for Nakota Earl James Kline. 
Court calls case.
Copy of complaint.
Atty Lyon heard - has reviewed with Deft.
Deft understands.
Waives formal reading.
Atty Lyon enters not guilty pleas to all counts on behalf of deft.
Requests status.
Court schedules with parties.
9:09 AM
Status conference scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 01:50 pm.
Authorization to Appear and Act - Atty Lyon

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Income Assignment Order for Unpaid Fines and Other Financial Obligations

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Dean Appt Atty Lyon- Repayment at $200/month Comm 7-1-2022
Letter from JA to Deft RE: Dean Atty
Income assignment order for unpaid fines and other financial obligations

9:43 AM Defendant Nakota Earl James Kline in court.  Attorney Morrow in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
Court inquires on atty.
Deft heard - does not qualify for PD.
Has completed dean paperwork and faxed to COC office, but the COC office has not received it yet.
Deft to go to the COC office to reproduce the form before leaving today.
Deft sworn in.
Deft to repay the dean fees at $200 per month, beginning 07-01-2022.
Atty Lyon is present and is heard - will take the case pending a conflict check.
DA provides a copy of the complaint.
Court reschedules with parties.
9:48 AM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:13 AM Defendant Nakota Earl James Kline in court.  Attorney Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
Deft heard - does not qualify for PD representation.
Will be hiring his own atty.
Court schedules with parties.
ADA heard on bond recommendation.
Deft heard.
Court heard and imposes $500 signature bond w/ conditions; sign waiver of extradition, no possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid Rx.
9:15 AM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
